meanings.definition: Excessively cautious or unwilling to take risks.
meanings.sent1: The overconservative driver always follows the speed limit, even on empty roads.
meanings.sent2: She missed out on many opportunities due to her overconservative nature.
meanings.sent3: The overconservative squirrel refused to try the new acorn flavor, sticking to the classic ones.
meanings.sent4: His overconservative approach to investing meant he missed out on potential gains.
meanings.sent5: Being overconservative in decision-making can sometimes lead to missed chances for growth.

meanings.definition: Holding traditional values and being resistant to change.
meanings.sent1: The overconservative elders in the village opposed any modern technology.
meanings.sent2: She was considered overconservative by her peers for always wearing vintage clothing.
meanings.sent3: The overconservative cat refused to use the new scratching post, preferring the old one.
meanings.sent4: His overconservative mindset kept him from embracing new ideas and innovations.
meanings.sent5: Being overconservative about traditions can sometimes hinder progress and adaptation.
